info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 9:43PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Snow Showers and Patchy Blowing and Drifting Snow... A narrow area of heavier snow showers over western Lake County as of 830 PM will exit east of Porter County by about 930 or 945 PM. The burst of heavier snow will cause brief low visibility below 1 mile and a quick coating of snow on roadways, causing slippery travel conditions. In addition, gusty winds from the west northwest behind the heavier snow may cause patchy blowing and drifting snow in rural and open, exposed areas. Those who are planning to drive through the late evening should leave extra time to reach their destinations. When driving on snow covered roads, drive slowly and increase following distance.
